newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch closing debt market report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch closing debt market report.

text.p: Dutch bonds slid into the close on Wednesday, after staying firm through most of the session, as a rapid pullback in U.S. Treasury futures fed through into the local market, dealers said.
But traders were encouraged at the higher levels of trade seen after a recent quiet period.
"We seem to be back in business again," one said. "I did a lot of trades today."
With no major data to focus on, the market forged ahead through most of the the day, supported by buoyant Bund futures, but had turned heavy by the late afternoon.
"It was definitely starting to look a little toppy and there wasn't much resistance when it started to push lower," one broker said.
Austria's 30-year guilder eurobond issue in the morning had drawn a lot of attention, he said.
The 1.0 billion guilder issue can be converted into an Austrian Bund when the country joins EMU and redenominates into euros if the Netherlands joins EMU.
Lead manager ABN AMRO Hoare Govett said there was pent-up demand for both the credit, well regarded by Dutch investors, and the maturity.
The bond was priced at 14 basis points over the 30-year State Loan and had indeed gone down well in the market, a trader said.
"It was a very nice issue and the market digested it with no problems at all," he said.
